text:
You ignore prompt basics.

But that’s why your prompts fail before you start:

☑ Give context. Your job, your audience, your limits.
☑ Set clear instructions. Define what success is.
☑ Use directives. Treat it like a partner, not Google.
☑ Break big asks into small steps. One at a time.
☑ Iterate. Chat, refine, and build on each answer.
☑ Set the format and tone. Don’t let it default.
☑ Share examples. Show what “good” looks like.

→ Good prompts are not wishes.
→ Good prompts are clear briefs.
→ Good prompts get good outputs.
→ Iteration beats length every time.
→ The R-E-X prompt works 99% of the time.
